thread.title: McMinnville police seek public's help in finding missing man
thread.title_full: McMinnville police seek public's help in finding missing man | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: McMinnville police seek public's help in finding missing man
text:
David "Hoss" Hostetler, 74 McMinnville Police Department A 74-year-old man has been missing since Friday, McMinnville police say, and authorities are turning to the public to help find him.
David "Hoss" Hostetler, 74, was last seen Friday at 12:30 a.m. when he left the local American Legion in his silver 1992 Honda Accord. The license plate number is BAPM. He was wearing a purple polo type shirt and black pants, police wrote in a news release. Hostetler is about 6 feet tall and weighs 220 pounds.
"It is unusual for Hoss to not be heard from, and he is without his medication," McMinnville police Capt. Tim Symons wrote in a news release.
Anyone who has information about Hostetler's whereabouts is asked to call the McMinnville Police Department at 503-434-6500 and refer case No. 15-4888.
